      void doSwitchDirection()
      Respond to the horiz/vert button (completion only) Switches the mode from horizontal to vertical, or back Ideally, (Challenge) it should show the user what the current state is, eg by drawing a horizonal/vertical bar in the top left corner, or by calling setText on the button to change the label

      • clearGraphics

        public void clearGraphics()
        Respond to the resistor button

      • doErase

        public void doErase(double x,
                    double y)
        Erase a circular region around the position x, y Should be big enough to erase a single component.

      • doMouse

        public void doMouse(java.lang.String action,
                    double x,
                    double y)
        Respond to mouse events When pressed, remember the position. When released, draw what is specified by current tool Uses the value stored in the field to determine which kind of component to draw (or to erase) It should call the drawWire, drawResistor, drawCapacitor, drawSource, drawLabel, or doErase, methods passing the x and y where the mouse was released.

      • doSetCapacitor

        public void doSetCapacitor()
        Respond to the capacitor button

        Respond to the eraser button

        public void doSetResistor()

        public void doSetSource()

      • doSetWire

        public void doSetWire()
        Respond to the wire button

      • doSwitchDirection

        public void doSwitchDirection()
        Respond to the horiz/vert button (completion only) Switches the mode from horizontal to vertical, or back Ideally, (Challenge) it should show the user what the current state is, eg by drawing a horizonal/vertical bar in the top left corner, or by calling setText on the button to change the label

      • drawCapacitor

        public void drawCapacitor(double x,
                          double y)
        Draw a capacitor centered at the point x, y. (Two parallel lines with wires on each side) Core: only horizontal required Completion: horizontal or a vertical, depending on the mode.

      • drawLabel

        public void drawLabel(double x,
                      double y)
        Draw a label at position x, y. Always horizontal. Uses the label that was stored in a field. Completion only.

      • drawResistor

        public void drawResistor(double x,
                         double y)
        Draw a resistor centered at the point x, y. (either a thin rectangle with short wires, or a zig-zag.) Core: only horizontal required Completion: horizontal or vertical depending on the mode.

      • drawSource

        public void drawSource(double x,
                       double y)
        Draw a source centered at the point x, y. (Circle with wires on each side) Core: only horizontal required Completion: horizontal or vertical, depending on the mode.

      • drawWire

        public void drawWire(double x,
                     double y)
        Draw a wire from the point where the user pressed the mouse to the point x,y. Core: may be a straight line. Completion: The wire should have a horizontal part followed by a vertical part If the distance between the two points is very small, it just puts a circle at (x y)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] arguments)

      • setupGUI

        public void setupGUI()
        Sets up the user interface - mouselistener, buttons, and (completion only) textField
